1) FORMATION
These terms and conditions are the only conditions upon which marcoms deals with the seller and shall administer in the purchase to the entire segregation of any other conditions. Any other conditions shall not be relevant unless expressly agreed in writing by both parties (Marcoms and Seller /Vendor).
2) DEFINITONS
The Supplier / Vendor agrees to supply the materials as per Marcoms descriptions, specifications, drawings, quantity, approved materials and quality as Marcoms standards
“Seller / Vendor shall represent the person, firm, company, or any other entity or supplier to whom the purchase order issued.
“Delivery Date “means the date or dates specified in the Purchase Order by which the supplier is required to deliver the works.
“Conditions “ states the terms and conditions set out here in which shall be binding on both parties ( Marcoms and seller /Vendor)
“Order “signifies Marcoms purchase order and specifications, approved materials, approved lay out drawings, to which terms and conditions herein shall apply.
“Work” signifies any goods services and or equipment or part thereof to be provided under the order,
“RFQ” stands for Request for Quotations issued by Marcoms in respect of the works or services
“Price “ stands for all amounts payable to seller in consideration of the work performed or supplied thereby,
“Delivery Note “stands for a document that accompanies a goods shipment and list details about the goods delivered.
Marcoms has issued a Purchase Order
The headings here in are convenience only and shall not affect the interpretations of this conditions
3) ORDER ACCEPTANCE
The Order will be binding upon receipt by the seller / vendor shall acknowledge email to Marcoms with in two (2) workings days of receipt of the order.
The Supplier /Vendor must ensure that supplied materials as per approved by UAE’s STANDARDS and HEALTY AND SAFETY.
The materials must be as per specified as per data sheet from the manufacture
The Supplier / Vendor will receive a local purchase as per approved quotations, material approved by Marcoms
The Supplier shall comply with all applicable laws, by-laws, ordinances, regulations, proclamations, orders and rules and with the lawful requirements of public authorities and other authorities in any way related to the supply of the Goods and/or the performance of Services, including without limitation all occupational health and safety laws
The Supplier shall maintain a complete and correct set of records pertaining to all aspects of the Purchase Order, including the performance hereof by the Supplier. The Purchaser shall, in order to verify that all transactions between Purchaser and Supplier satisfy all of the terms and conditions of the Purchaser Order, have the right, by audit to inspect those records of Supplier pertaining to the Purchase Order hereunder within a period of four (4) years from the provision of Goods and/or Services
4) WARRANTIES
The Seller warrants that the work shall :

Conform to requirements , scope of works , specifications , drawings, quantity, samples provided or any other descriptions outlined in the RFQ and the order
Prove to be accordance with good customarily employed practice and of sound materials and workmanship and capable of any standard of performance specified in the order
Be without defects and fit for its intended purposes for which the order is placed
The seller / vendor warrants that the work shall be carried out by suitable competent personnel and equipment supplied shall be in safe operations conditions. Seller / vendor shall replace as soon as practicable any such equipment or personnel at sellers cost and risk in case they are not adequate to Marcoms
The seller warrants that the work will at no time infringe any intellectual property rights or any other right relating to any third party.
The Supplier shall maintain, at its own expense, all necessary insurance cover for its liabilities to cover all events that may cause loss of, or damage to property, or injury to, or death of a person arising out of, or in course of, or by reason of the supply of Goods, Liability, Products Liability and Goods in Transit until delivered to the Purchaser.
5) DEFECTS
The Seller / Vendor shall provide a warranty period or twelve ( 12) months or as stated within the contract or as sellers proposal as the date that works is put into service by the seller ( the Warranty Period)
The Supplier /Vendor to deliver materials as per Marcoms deadlines and schedule, in case of delays or damages during delivery, the supplier is liable for any related cost and damages.
The seller shall be responsible for remedying at its expenses any defects that may arise from the works during the warranty period. Seller shall guarantee for a further period of twelve months or as assigned in the contract all remedial works carried out under this warranty. Where a defect arises within the warranty period but does not become apparent until the warranty period has expired, sellers liability shall not cease merely because MARCOMS has been unable to give notice of the defect to seller within the said warranty period, if any defects which seller is obliged to remedy under this clause are not remedied within a reasonable time or circumstances render it impracticable for seller to do the same. Marcoms may do so himself or authorizes others to do same, and seller shall reimburse Marcoms for all costs arising there from. This warranty and Marcoms remedies hereunder are in addition to Marcoms other rights and remedies existing under the order or at law
Marcoms reserves the right to reject any goods or services or to revoke any previous acceptance and cancel all or any part of this order if the seller fails to deliver or provide all or any part of the work performed in accordance with the terms and conditions of this order.
6) TERMS OF PAYMENT
The Delivery or commencement and completion of works shall be as per the date and period specified in the order or pre-approved variation order as the case may be, failing which Marcoms shall be entitled to terminate the order or any part thereof, failure to meet the delivery as agreed upon shall be considered a breach of these conditions and the seller shall be responsible to pay penalty and damages imposed upon or incurred by Marcoms ( if any ) for failure of seller / vendor or contractor to deliver work according to the order, furthermore, the seller shall bear the cost of packaging, loading and carriage of the work unless otherwise agreed upon between both parties hereto ( Marcoms and Seller/Vendor /Contractor)

If the work is delivered to Marcoms in excess of the quantities ordered. Marcoms shall not be bound to pay for the excess and any excess will be and will remain at the sellers risk and will be returnable at the seller’s expenses.
Marcoms will not take responsible for loss of goods without delivery note shown and sign by marcoms authorized person.
MARCOMS has the right to the cancel the local purchase order in case of non-compliance of the supplied materials.
The Supplier /Vendor agrees to the terms and conditions as per approved credit facility’s terms and conditions
The Supplier /Vendor payment terms and condition should not affect the delivery of the materials
All Sales invoices and Tax invoices must be submitted to accounts by end of month or after deliveries for reconciliations and records
The invoice must be submitted with completion certificate, Delivery note duly signed by end user from Marcoms, together with purchase order and duly stamped to Marcoms satisfaction or acknowledge (as received) where applicable to finance division, if these documents are not provided within 30 days of completion of works or delivery , Marcoms will close the PO and any payments under the PO will be freeze for processing.
If the work is not correctly delivered or performed or Marcoms has not accepted the work, the invoice shall be paid thirty (30) days following the date when discrepancy is corrected to Marcoms satisfaction and relevant documents are submitted to finance division.
7) INSPECTION AND TESTING
The Seller / Vendor agrees to permit Marcoms to inspect and test the works any time prior to acceptance or delivery as the case may be.
Marcoms shall have the rights without prejudice to any right which Marcoms may have against the seller to reject any work performed or delivered by the seller if such work is defective or in noncompliance with the terms and condition herein
Any work so rejected shall immediately be replaced or corrected as required by Marcoms at seller’s expenses. Sellers shall re submit the re-performed works for re –inspection and re testing. Such replacement or remedy shall not relieve the seller from any liability due to defects subsequently found in the work in terms of materials and or workmanship.
A notice not less than five (5) calendar days shall be given to Marcoms in order to inspect and test the works.
8) DELAY IN PENALTIES
IN CASE of delay on part of the seller in completing the works within the agreed timing, the seller shall liable to pay Marcoms as penalties a sum equivalent to 10 % of the total LPO value per day or part thereof up to a maximum of 20 % of the value of the LPO, should delay continue for a period exceeding the above Marcoms , without prejudice to any other remedy available under the law , may terminate the agreement with our the need of the any official or judicial action or assign the services to another provider and charge any cost differences to the contractor.
The Supplier /Vendor to deliver materials as per Marcoms deadlines and schedule, in case of delays or damages during delivery, the supplier is liable for any related cost and damages.
9) VARIATIONS
Seller shall perform any changes to the works required by Marcoms which may include additions to or reductions in, the quantity and quality of works. Marcoms shall give notice of such changes to seller in writing who shall prompt advice Marcoms in writing on their reasonable effect on price and delivery notes, subject to sub clause, no change shall be accepted by Marcoms unless authorized by written instruction and confirmed by a change order signed by Marcoms.

In the event that the parties are unable to agree on the reasonable effects on price and delivery date, Marcoms shall nevertheless have the right to inquire seller to proceed with the changes forthwith
No Variation in the price nor extra charges can be made (whether on account of increased materials, labor or transport cost or fluctuation in rates of exchange or otherwise) without the formal written consent of Marcoms.
10) ASSIGNMENT AND SUB CONTRACTING
Seller shall not assign or sub contract any part of the works without Marcoms prior written consent. No Assignment or sub-contracting shall relieve seller of any of its obligation under the order. Seller shall ensure that these conditions will be applied in all sub contracts entered into by seller.
11) SAFETY OBLIGATIONS
Any Work provided , supplied or installed shall be so executed , formulated, designed , constructed , finished and packaged as to be safe and without any risk to healthy ,safety and environment and all work shall be supplied with full instructions for its proper use maintenance and repair and with any necessary warming notices clearly displayed.
Seller shall provide Marcoms in writing with such information as is necessary relating to the use of any goods and / or equipment supplied and or used and its design, testing and use, relating to any conditions necessary to ensure it will be safe and without risk to health when properly handled, stored, transported and used. Failing to do so , seller / contractor will be responsible for any damage incurred by the Marcoms, its employees or customers , seller / contractor shall abide by applicable laws , regulations , customs and good practice and where appreciate shall comply with the requirements of the Marcoms Management, concerning environments, health and safety requirement as may be amended from time to time.
12) SUSPENSIONS AND TERMINATION
MARCOMS may suspend party or as a whole at any time the performance of the Works. In such event, MARCOMS shall pay to Contractor for the Services already satisfactory performed up to the suspension.
Notwithstanding any dispute arising between the Parties during the performance of the PO, the Seller shall continue to perform the Services and shall not suspend or delay it whether fully or party for any reason without the prior written consent of MARCOMS.
MARCOMS shall be entitled to terminate or suspend the Order by giving a 30 days written notice to Seller at any time if Seller is in default of or in breach of any obligations here under, including without limitation compliance with any delivery date. Or in case the Seller becomes bankrupt or insolvent, or has a receiver or administrative receiver appointed over it or over any part of its undertaking or assets, or passes a resolution for winding-up (otherwise than for the purposes of a bona fide scheme of solvent merge or reconstruction). Or if court of competent jurisdiction makes an order to that effect, or if the other party becomes subject to an administration order or enters into any voluntary arrangement with its creditors or ceases or threatens to cease to carry on business. In such event, Seller shall be liable to MARCOMS for any losses or cost it might have incurred.
Without prejudice to MARCOMS other nights of suspension or termination, MARCOMS shall be entitled to enter Seller’s premises or any place where the Work is situated and take possession of the whole or any part of the Work.

13) TITLE AND RISK
Title of the works shall pass to MARCOMS on the delivery and actual acceptance thereof by MARCOMS.
Notwithstanding passage of title (in whole or in part) on the occurrence of Sub- clause (14.1) above, risk shall remain with Seller until delivery or until acceptance of the Work by
14) INDEMNITIES AND INSURANCE
Seller shall exercise all reasonable skill, care and diligence in carrying out his obligations, under this WSO and shall indemnify MARCOMS and hold MARCOMS harmless against any claims, damages, law suites, and loses which MARCOMS might suffer as a result of the Seller's breach of this WSO, negligence, willful misconduct, infringement of any valid patent or copyright, disclosure of information obtained by the Contractor during the performance of this WSO, or otherwise.
Without prejudice to MARCOMS'S indemnification under Article 15.1 above, if the Seller is found liable to MARCOMS for any extra cost, MARCOMS shall be entitled to deduct such sums from the Contractor's financial entitlement, or seek any other formal remedial procedure to cover such liability.
The Seller herein shall be solely responsible for ensuring that appropriate insurance exists as applicable including but not limited to Workmen's Compensation and Employer's Liability, third party liability, Motor Vehicles and Public Liability and that adequate cover extends to the risks and events associated with the Services.
The insurance policies obtained by Seller shall include MARCOMS as an additional beneficiary and contain a waiver of Insurer's rights of subrogation against MARCOMS, its Agents, all Employees, Engineers, Contractors/Sub-Contractors rendering services for MARCOMS at the same site/location as the Contractor
15) FORCE MAJEURE
If either Party claims that it is affected by Force Majeure it shall bear the burden of proving that it is so affected and shall promptly notify the other Party of the nature and range of the circumstances in question.
Notwithstanding any other provision of this Purchase Order, neither Party shall be deemed to be in breach of this PO, or be liable to the other, for any delay in performance of any of its obligations under this Purchase Order, if the delay or nonperformance is due to any Force Majeure of which it has notified the other Party, and the time for performance of that obligation shall be extended accordingly.
16) LIENS AND CLAIMS
Seller agrees to pay, discharge and hold MARCOMS harmless from all liens, claims (including legal fees and other expenses incidental thereto), judgments and awards which may arise out of or in connection with the Order. Seller shall at MARCOMS's request, furnish proof satisfactory to MARCOMS that all such liens, claims, suits, judgments and awards have been satisfiedMARCOMS shall also have the right to make payment direct to any holder of such line or claimant such payments to be reimbursed by Seller on demand
Seller agrees to waive any right to exercise a lien, to make a claim or seek enforcement of a judgment or award against the Work at any time and acknowledges that its sole right in the event of any failure by MARCOMS to perform any of its obligations under the Order is to seek financial relief in respect thereof.
17) INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS
Seller irrevocably assigns its entire right, title and interest to any Intellectual Property Rights it may have at any time in the Work (the "Seller Intellectual Property Rights") to MARCOMS, including the right to initiate court or other proceedings or to take any other action against any person for infringement of the Seller Intellectual Property Rights.
All patterns, tools, drawings or documents, whether in hard copy or otherwise, supplied by MARCOMS shall remain MARCOMS's property and shall All patterns, tools, drawings or documents, whether in hard copy or otherwise, supplied by MARCOMS shall remain MARCOMS's property and shall not be used by Seller in the service of any other company. All such items shall be returned to MARCOMS upon completion of the Work or at MARCOMS instruction.

All materials or equipment to be incorporated in the Work the title of which has passed to MARCOMS shall be clearly marked as MARCOMS's property and shall be stored separately from Seller's property.
18) ERRORS
Seller shall immediately notify MARCOMS in writing of any error, omission, deficiency, ambiguity or contradiction in the Order and shall not commence or continue with performance of the Work until written clarification from MARCOMS has been obtained.
19) GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION
The Order and Conditions herein shall be construed and interpreted in accordance with the laws of Abu Dhabi, UAE without regard to any conflicts-of-laws rules or principles that might refer the governance or construction to any other jurisdiction. Any dispute arising in relation to these Conditions shall be referred to Abu Dhabi Court
20) NOTICES
Notices shall be validly given if sent by facsimile, Telex or recorded delivery post to the respective addresses of the parties stated in the Order or to any address subsequently notified in writing by one party to the other.
21) ENTIRETY
These Conditions incorporates the entire agreement between the parties hereto with respect to the subject matters covered herein and supersedes all prior agreements and understanding written or oral any amendment hereto shall be mutually agreed upon in writing.
22) CONFIDENTIALITY
The Seller shall hold in confidence and not divulge to third Parties or use in any way other than for the purpose of this Purchase Order except with the prior written approval of MARCOMS, any information disclosed, directly or indirectly, to the Seller by MARCOMS, unless such information is available in or hereinafter properly enters the public domain.
23) WAIVER
Any failure of MARCOMS to enforce at any time or for any period of time, any ofthe provisions of these Conditions shall not constitute a waiver of such provisions.
24) INFORMATION SECURITY POLICY
SERVICE PROVIDER shall comply with MARCOMS's "Information Security Policy ", to view the Policy please visit (www.marcoms.com) and linkage of " Information Security Policy
25) AUDIT
The Seller must provide access at all reasonable times to MARCOMS's auditors, internal and external, the UAE National Auditors Office, and any other duly authorized staff or agents to examine the accounts or inspect such documents and records as MARCOMS considers necessary whether those of the Seller's or any of its Subcontractors (this would include all of its IT equipment, documents, papers, records, licensed software, security configuration and settings of equipment, user access rights on the equipment and any records in electronic form, including but not limited to computer hard drives, tape backups and other such storage devices.) in connection with this PO irrespective of the location of such accounts, records or documents, to do a routine Audit or to ensure compliance with MARCOMS ISMS.
